topic.title: MAPOTN Abstract

body.p: The OTN Mapper subsystem (MAPOTN) performs OPU (Optical Channel Payload Unit) overhead, CBR (Constant Bit Rate) client data and consequential actions processing across 120 channels concurrently (up to 600G) for the device. The MAPOTN supports Bit Synchronous Mapping Procedure (BMP), including BGMP and IMP, Generic Mapping Procedure (GMP) for mapping of the CBR client data in ODUk container and Generic Framing Procedure (GFP-F). The MAPOTN primarily has 3 interfaces. The line I/F (towards the COREOTN subsystem), and two client I/F (one towards the DCPB subsystem and one towards the ENET subsystem via ECPB).

The details of supported ODUk rates at each of these I/F's are highlighted in detail in the mapotn_ss_requirements spreadsheet 2 . The MAPOTN supports mapping and de-mapping defined for the client data in ODUk container.
